issues.description:
Reentrancy in Reentrance.withdrawBalance() (../../../tmp/user1/contracts/swc-107-reentrancy-eth.sol#14-21):
	External calls:
	- ! (msg.sender.call.value(userBalance[msg.sender])()) (../../../tmp/user1/contracts/swc-107-reentrancy-eth.sol#17)
	State variables written after the call(s):
	- userBalance[msg.sender] = 0 (../../../tmp/user1/contracts/swc-107-reentrancy-eth.sol#20)
	Reentrance.userBalance (../../../tmp/user1/contracts/swc-107-reentrancy-eth.sol#4) can be used in cross function reentrancies:
	- Reentrance.addToBalance() (../../../tmp/user1/contracts/swc-107-reentrancy-eth.sol#10-12)
	- Reentrance.getBalance(address) (../../../tmp/user1/contracts/swc-107-reentrancy-eth.sol#6-8)
	- Reentrance.withdrawBalance() (../../../tmp/user1/contracts/swc-107-reentrancy-eth.sol#14-21)
	- Reentrance.withdrawBalance_fixed() (../../../tmp/user1/contracts/swc-107-reentrancy-eth.sol#23-31)
	- Reentrance.withdrawBalance_fixed_2() (../../../tmp/user1/contracts/swc-107-reentrancy-eth.sol#33-40)

issues.swc_title: Message call with hardcoded gas amount

issues.description:
A call to a user-supplied address is executed.
An external message call to an address specified by the caller is executed. Note that the callee account might contain arbitrary code and could re-enter any function within this contract. Reentering the contract in an intermediate state may lead to unexpected behaviour. Make sure that no state modifications are executed after this call and/or reentrancy guards are in place.

A call to a user-supplied address is executed.
An external message call to an address specified by the caller is executed. Note that the callee account might contain arbitrary code and could re-enter any function within this contract. Reentering the contract in an intermediate state may lead to unexpected behaviour. Make sure that no state modifications are executed after this call and/or reentrancy guards are in place.

Write to persistent state following external call
The contract account state is accessed after an external call to a user defined address. To prevent reentrancy issues, consider accessing the state only before the call, especially if the callee is untrusted. Alternatively, a reentrancy lock can be used to prevent untrusted callees from re-entering the contract in an intermediate state.
